message.content:
cs.FL, cs.DS, cs.LO, cs.CC, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the complexity of computing a piecewise testable separator for regular languages represented by nondeterministic finite automata. This topic falls under the category of formal languages and automata theory, which is covered by cs.FL. The paper also involves the study of infinite towers and their relationship with piecewise testable languages, which could be classified under cs.DS (data structures and algorithms) or cs.LO (logic in computer science). Additionally, the paper discusses upper and lower bounds on the complexity of computing piecewise testable separators, which could be related to computational complexity (cs.CC) or information theory (cs.IT).
